summary: The origin of life, or abiogenesis, is the fascinating process where life emerged from non-living things. It's like a complex puzzle with many stages. Scientists believe Earth's early conditions allowed simple molecules to form and gradually become more complex. This led to the creation of cell-like structures and self-replicating molecules, possibly RNA. The last universal common ancestor (LUCA) of all life was likely a simple organism that lived billions of years ago. Researchers study ancient rocks and fossils to understand these early life forms, focusing on how they used energy and built complex molecules.
title: Abiogenesis
